title.narrative: Cote d'Ivoire COVID-19 Strategic Preparedness and Response Project (SPRP)

description.narrative: To prevent, detect, and respond to the threat posed by COVID-19 and strengthen national systems for public health preparedness in Cote d'Ivoire.

participating-org.narrative: Ministere de la Sante et de l'Hygiene Publique (MSHP)

condition.narrative: Article IV, 4.02: The Co-financing Deadline for the effectiveness of the Co-financing Agreement is the date forty-five (45) daysafter the Effective Date.

Schedule 2, Section I, B, 1(a). The Recipient shall by no later than one (1) month, after the Effective Date, prepare and adopt aProject implementation manual (“Project Implementation Manual”) containing detailed guidelines and procedures for theimplementation of the Project, including with respect to: administration and coordination, monitoring and evaluation, financialmanagement, procurement and accounting procedures, environmental and social safeguards, corruption and fraud mitigation measures, agrievance redress mechanism, eligibility criteria and procedures for the CNAM Premiums, the Cash Transfers and the Hazard Pay,personal data collection and processing in accordance with the applicable WHO and national guidelines, roles and responsibilitiesfor Project implementation, and such other arrangements and procedures as shall be required for the effective implementation of theProject, in form and substance satisfactory to the Association.

Schedule 2, Section I, B, 2(a) by no later than one (1) month after the Effective Date, prepare a draft work plan and budget forProject implementation, setting forth, inter alia: (i) a detailed description of the planned activities, including any proposedconferences and Training, under the Project for the period covered by the plan; (ii) the sources and proposed use of fundstherefor; (iii) procurement and environmental and social safeguards arrangements therefor, as applicable and; (iv) responsibilityfor the execution of said Project activities, budgets, start and completion dates, outputs and monitoring indicators to trackprogress of each activity;

Schedule 2, Section I,A,3. The Recipient shall ensure that the PIU (i) recruits an accountant and an assistant accountant and (ii)updates the accounting software no later than two (2) months after the Effective Date.

Schedule 2, Section I,A,3. The Recipient shall ensure that the PIU: (a) recruits an accountant and an assistant accountant; and (b)updates the accounting software no later than two (2) months after the Effective Date.

Schedule 2, Section I,B,1(a) The Recipient shall by no later than one (1) month, after the Effective Date, update the Projectimplementation manual for the Original Project (as so updated, “Project Implementation Manual”) containing detailed guidelines andprocedures for the implementation of the Project, including with respect to: administration and coordination, monitoring andevaluation, financial management, procurement and accounting procedures, environmental and social safeguards, operating rules andpayment procedures of the NFCF, corruption and fraud mitigation measures, a grievance redress mechanism, eligibility criteria,personal data collection and processing in accordance with the applicable WHO and national guidelines, roles and responsibilitiesfor Project implementation, and such other arrangements and procedures as shall be required for the effective implementation of theProject, in form and substance satisfactory to the Association.

Schedule 2, Section I,B,2(a) (a) by no later than one (1) month after the Effective Date, prepare a draft work plan and budget forProject implementation, setting forth, inter alia: (i) a detailed description of the planned activities, including any proposedconferences and Training, under the Project for the period covered by the plan; (ii) the sources and proposed use of fundstherefor; (iii) procurement and environmental and social safeguards arrangements therefor, as applicable and; (iv) responsibilityfor the execution of said Project activities, budgets, start and completion dates, outputs and monitoring indicators to trackprogress of each activity

Shedule 2, Section I, B,2 : (a) by no later than one (1) month after the Effective Date, prepare a draft work plan and budget forProject implementation, setting forth, inter alia: (i) a detailed description of the planned activities, including any proposedconferences and Training, under the Project for the period covered by the plan; (ii) the sources and proposed use of funds thereforincluding the Co-financier’s shares of the costs; (iii) procurement and environmental and social safeguards arrangements therefor,as applicable; and (iv) responsibility for the execution of said Project activities, budgets, start and completion dates, outputsand monitoring indicators to track progress of each activity;

title.narrative: Proportion of deaths among confirmed COVID-19 cases (dissagregated by sex)
Number of healthcare workers trained by project on COVID-19 infection, prevention and control (IPC), preparedness and response (dissagregated by sex)
Number of structures (health facility, isolation centers, and cold chain) renovated and/or equipped
Number of severe cases of COVID-19 treated (disaggregated by sex)
Number of suspected COVID-19 patients who test positive (disaggregated by sex)
Number of suspected cases of COVID-19 reported and investigated based on national guidelines (dissagregated by sex)
Proportion of vaccination sites that transmit their data via DHIS2
Percentage of the population covered by the communication, consultantion, social and community mobilization interventions
Proportion of health districts with committees for the management of complaints
Percentage of complaints managed according to project GRM protocol
Percentage of the target population vaccinated against COVID-19 vaccine (disaggregated by sex)
Proportion of health districts covered by communication activities
Proportion of health districts with a budgeted micro-plan for COVID-19 vaccination campaign, according to the evolution of different phases of the campaign
Number of local radio stations communicating awareness campaigns about COVID-19 and the COVID-19 vaccination campaign
Total number of AEFIs notified (disagregated as severe or non-severe)
Proportion of planned communication interventions implemented
Percentage of priority population vaccinated, based on the targets defined in the National Plan (disaggregated by priority group and sex)
